page.title: 01PEBMARSH:A GENERAL VIEW
page.content: Pebmarsh is a small village full of different sorts of people and different sorts of houses.Much of the surrounding land is taken up by farms.Most of the local farmers grow crops but some of the land is used for pasture.The land is mainly flat with a number of woods and small valleys.There is a fourteenth century church and a modern Primary School built in 1966.The Village Hall hosts such clubs as the Countryman's Club and the W.I.The local Pub dates from the fifteenth century.There is a Post Office and shop which has a limited range of food and goods.The playing-field near the School has a see-saw,a swing,a climbing-frame and a sandpit which is often flooded.Pebmarsh has a Garage which now sells Derv and petrol.
